attributes.action: Stop live music venues being closed by house buyers who chose to live there.
attributes.background: Fewer venues are open for musicians to play in because of home owners who complain AFTER buying.  The venue is then closed. Buyers should sign an acknowledgment of the venue as part of the buying process.
attributes.additional_details: Musicians have few places left to play.  This will be to the detriment of our potentially rich live music future and will effect tourism and local culture.  When all music venues are gone, the same people who complained about noise will bemoan it's loss.

attributes.action: Save Kingfisher Ward and Scbu at Dorchester County Hospital!!
attributes.background: The facilities for the care of very small babies and children are due to be cut drastically. This will involve having to travel at least an hour to get the medical care needed. This is just quite frankly ridiculous!! Time in an emergency is one of the key factors in the best chances of survival.

attributes.action: Ban weapons using nanotechnology before they are able to be produced
attributes.background: Nanotechnology could be reality in the next few years and, while there are many benefits of this, the potential of nanotech weapons is too great a threat to humanity to be allowed, these weapons must be banned before they can be produced to prevent the devistation that could arise from their use

attributes.action: Give the HSE more powers under the law to regulate gas safety for consumers.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements. The HSE need legal powers to be effective.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health & Safety Executive must be able to hold Gas Safe and it's engineers to account and ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance

2} have a legal minimum boiler service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE should complete robust checks on standards of work & update the registration process.

attributes.action: Close or take drastic measures to improve the 111 nhs service.
attributes.background: The NHS 111 service continually provide incorrect information and put people's lives at risk and put extra strain on the hospitals, doctors and the ambulance service. They also don't listen to what the problem is , they read a computer screen.

attributes.action: Require by law Landlords/Ladies to change mattresses between different tenants.
attributes.background: Hi. I'm just another student in the London renting market. Yep, that open sewer of real estate. Thanks to not being provided a new mattress when I moved in to a property, I have had both fleas and bedbugs. I am asking that the government require new mattresses for new tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
When I moved into a property two years ago my mattress had been left in the shed for a "few" days whilst work was done on my room. Instead of receiving a new mattress I got the old one from the previous tenant, plus some new friends - fleas! 
This year, I moved into a property and discovered the old mattress was infested with bed bugs! Thanks previous tenant! 
Whilst it may be expensive to replace mattresses, no tenant should have to live through bug infestations.

attributes.action: Standardise ID requirements for all public and quasi-public bodies
attributes.background: At present any public authority (or quasi public authority such as a utility company or railway) can randomly select what ID requirements are needed from members of the public to interact with them.  Surely this could be standardised for all such institutions through very simple legislation.
attributes.additional_details: For instance some PAs (eg the Bank of England if you want to exchange old bank notes) will accept a driver's licence as proof over address, others (eg my local authority issuing a parking permit) will only accept a utility bill less than 3 months old and not if it is copied from an on-line bill.   NB this is NOT a request for introduction of compulsory ID cards.

attributes.action: Review the exempted conditions and ages for NHS prescription charges
attributes.background:
The list of exempt conditions and age limits have not been reviewed and inequalities now exist.
1. Some life-long life-threatening conditions make sufferers eligible for free prescriptions even when not related to their condition, others receive no support.
2. The age limit of 60 is out of date.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Some of the biggest killers are not currently covered by exemptions such as heart disease. This can mean that people may miss medication to keep them well.
2. The current system encourages those exempt to visit a Dr to obtain prescriptions for minor illnesses when medication is available over the counter. This costs the NHS time and money.
3. As retirement ages increase and people are working longer it is logical that other benefits should remain aligned to the same age.

attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: Where possible, make it policy for cars used by all authorities, be British made
attributes.background: It only seems logical for cars used by the police force, or even any other public body, buy cars with the vast majority of their supply chain in Britain - as long as the car serves that particular purpose and is cost effective. Not only does it decrease a carbon footprint, it safeguards an industry.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Primary & secondary school teachers should be paid a minimum of £25,000 PA
attributes.background: Teaching is crucial in getting children the best learning and teachers are not paid enough for the amount of work they do. They should be paid a minimum of £25,000 with it to raise to £30,000 a year minimum after 3 years at the same school. This will help teachers become more stable at 1 school.

attributes.action: Consider moving Britain’s Parliament to Manchester
attributes.background: As a solution to the problem of the eye watering expense of renovating The Palace of Westminster
attributes.additional_details: http://www.economist.com/blogs/bagehot/2017/02/go-north

attributes.action: Longer prison sentences for rape, murder and serious crimes.
attributes.background: A 23-year-old man was lured to a park and beaten for several hours and later died,The murderers were given 20 & 21 yrs. A man has been jailed for 12 years after he attacked a woman so badly that her face became completely detached from her skull. Given 12 yrs. NOT LONG ENOUGH!
attributes.additional_details: We keep getting told that our prisons are over crowded! they may well be, but how many of those offer no threat to the general public? let them out and get them doing work for the community and free the beds for the rapist, murders and child sex offenders that we want off our streets so it can be a safer place to bring a family up in. And then give longer sentences to these offenders and that might deter others, and they will think twice before reoffending. Then our prisons will have vacancies.

attributes.action: Ensure government treats mental and physical health equally on PIP eligibility.
attributes.background: The Department for Work and Pensions has been told by two court rulings to treat mental and physical health claimants equally by ensuring those with psychological health conditions are eligible for Personal Independence Payment.
attributes.additional_details: Psychological conditions such as anxiety incur additional costs of non NHS funded prescription medication for instance Finasteride which helps individuals attain some personal independence. Government rhetoric has insisted those with mental health conditions are treated equally with physical health conditions. While individuals with physical health conditions receive mobility assistance in the form of Personal Independence Payment, those with mental health conditions do not receive this.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties against Hash smoking or possession
attributes.background: I am a London resident who has to deal with hash smokers every day. These people aren't like weed smokers, they are so much worse. The hash smells so much and stinks my building up, plus the hash they're smoking is mostly rubber and mud and it does horrible things to their bodies unlike weed smoke.

attributes.action: In the event of Scotland's independence all Government contracts be cancelled.
attributes.background: In recent years many vital services such as ship building has been moved to Scotland to assist in employment and local economy but at the expense of English towns and workers who have trained and been in their industries for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Portsmouth docks and ship building and repairs were moved to Scotland. Work that was originally carried out for repairs to Naval vessels in Woolston Southampton were withdrawn and now are carried out in Scotland.

attributes.action: Scottish vote for independence! The Scottish government pays!
attributes.background: The Scottish government has had it's chance. The rest of the of the UK should not have to pay because the First Minister did not like the result of the first vote.

attributes.action: Replace number plates with a road-tax disk like bar code
attributes.background: Many people do not like the look of number plates due to the bulky look & on many new cars, they do not seem to match aesthetically. Also, number plates can be stolen easily however with a tax-disk like sticker it is harder. It would reduce the amount of number plate thefts; assisting the police.
attributes.additional_details: For police investigation, they can read it like a number plate and it will come up on the police computer with all of the vehicles details.

attributes.action: Sugar Tax: Government to re-debate Sugar Tax and potentially scrap Sugar Tax
attributes.background: Debate to consider: undesirable side effects of artificial sweeteners (AS); aspartame approved at current levels of consumption. Levels may increase due to ST; choice to consume natural product (sugar); tax from ST to research health impact of AS and fund nutrition education
attributes.additional_details: The Sugar Tax compromises and demonizes the use of a natural substance and promotes synthesized products. Sugar has been used for centuries to sweeten food. We know the side effects of its excessive consumption. In comparison, artificial sweeteners are a new phenomenon. Not enough conclusive research has been carried out for the Government to decree that sweeteners are a healthy alternative to sugar. For example, research into aspartame concluded it is both safe and a potential source of cancer.

attributes.action: Standardise dress sizes
attributes.background: It's about time that we standardise dress sizes here in the UK. The fact that a woman could be a size 8 and a size 16 in the same shop is ridiculous.  This is 2017 and it's about time there were guidelines for suppliers to follow.
attributes.additional_details: This affects everyone from babies, woman of all ages, shapes and sizes to our young impressionable girls who already have to struggle with what the media tells them they have to look like.

attributes.action: Discontinue the practice of Prime Minister's Questions
attributes.background:
The ongoing insult to the UK citizens intelligence every Wednesday in Parliament due to the dishonesty and insult hurling which has become the norm under recent Prime Ministers. 
The establishment of  rules and disciplines are needed to allow this to become a meaningful and accountable process.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to start driving lessons.
attributes.background: Lower the legal age to start driving lessons to 16. This will allow teens to start driving and prepare people to start driving once they are 17. A friend of mine started driving lessons at 17 and only got his license at 23 years of age. The struggle is real.

attributes.action: Decision on brexit should need 2nd poll if it involves exit from customs union
attributes.background: The customs union and free trade area were not referred to on the ballot paper in the referendum and could have had an effect on the result if it had been stated on the ballot paper. The UK population should have a final say on all implications if leaving the above is part of the Brexit deal

attributes.action: Ban airlines' seat allocation fees for families
attributes.background: Nowadays marketing is getting mad and air companies are trying to get more monies from people for needless services, where there should a must. Children and families are paying nearly £100 extra to be sure that they will sit together with their children or relatives, husbands, wife on airplanes.
attributes.additional_details:
This fee must be banned for families, as this is extra money on top of the paid charges for holidays, which already cost a lot. 
Air companies are making money from nothing.

attributes.action: No exemption of neutralisation fee for residents - Equal and fair Treatment
attributes.background:
Everyone should be treated equally and fairly. 
If any nation is exempted everyone should be exempted and refunded accordingly. 
It's the policy of state, cannot be a favour.
attributes.additional_details:
Polish national are asking for exemption of Neturalisation fee which I see very unfair to other UK Residence permit holders.

All residents must be weight in same scale. 
Britain ruled most of works alone and can stand strong on its own feet.
Britain is not dependent on any nation.

attributes.action: Give more advice and provide help for free to the parents of obese children.
attributes.background: Children who are obese have higher risks of heart disease and other illnesses so it would be very important to lower the numbers of kids who are in need of help. Providing more help by making their parents aware of this and sending them free leaflets on how to help their child(ren) would be helpful.
attributes.additional_details: The number of obese children would change dramatically and fall if further support was given to parents or careers of children. Obesity levels in the UK are really high compared to other European countries and the world. Meal plans, guidance and leaflets with facts on obesity should be given to parents or careers so they can help their child lose weight and decrease chances of breathing difficulty, high blood pressure or a stroke in the future.

attributes.action: Nobody should be able to contest a Will.
attributes.background: If someone makes a Will when of sound mind then their wishes should be respected. If Wills can be contested then what is the point in paying a solicitor to write one in the first place?

attributes.action: Review the current deportation system, and address its surrounding concerns.
attributes.background: Review gov. process of deportations, particularly through charter flights; address their impact on detainees. Address the impact of deportation centres, especially on children. Address lack of care for legal proceedings and claims before deportations. Address violence and racism on charter flights.
attributes.additional_details:
People subject to the UK deportation system are in a vulnerbale place, and there are many issues which need to be addressed.

I have written an article with references: http://writingco.tumblr.com/post/157272986629/secretive-night-flights-the-uks-un-reviewed 

Most powerful sources: http://www.medicaljustice.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/state-sponsored-cruelty.pdf & http://www.refugeecouncil.org.uk/what_we_do/childrens_services/working_with_age_disputed_children/children_in_detention

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have avoided detection for 10 years
attributes.background: Amnesty to those who have avoided detection for 10 years would be economically beneficial. These people are unable to contribute to this economy, unable to pay taxes, even though they have been work (cash in hand i.e) and unable to take proper part in society.

attributes.action: Increase the Marriage Tax Allowance
attributes.background: At present more marriage tax relief is afforded couples in their 80s and 90s, than on all other marriages including those caring for young children. Whilst we should of course care for our elderly, we should give a significant married tax break to young families who also need our help.
attributes.additional_details: Philip Hammond under pressure to increase marriage tax allowance: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/01/16/philip-hammond-pressure-increase-marriage-tax-allowance/

attributes.action: PE should not be a core subject in secondary school!
attributes.background: Some students get bullied in PE because they're not good at doing the activities they are told to do e.g running, and some students are not confident enough to do PE. I personally think that PE should not be a core subject, it should be our choice if we want to study this subject or not.
attributes.additional_details: As a GCSE student, I don't think that P.E is going to help us in the future unless we want to become a PE teacher, personal trainer, Athlete etc. Therefore, we should have the right to choose.

attributes.action: Reject Brexit If The UK Fails To Maintain Access To The Single Market
attributes.background: The EU countries make up 53% of  imports and 44% of British exports. Leaving the European Union would put Britains position in the single market in doubt meaning the introduction of tariffs on trade. This would mean an increase in prices of imported products and less foreign investment.

attributes.action: The time has come for a Compulsory test for cyclists.
attributes.background: with the increase of  cycling in the UK in recent years deaths of cyclists on British roads are increasing . There is already a test but its not compulsory , the National Standards for Cycle training test known as Bike -ability.
attributes.additional_details: the death rate on Britain's roads is reducing thankfully, but the exception is with cyclist's.  I have never understood the logic of untrained people using busy roads and risking their lives daily. If a cyclist is a driver then they will have taken the driving test and know the rules of the road, but many are non drivers and are a danger to themselves and others.

attributes.action: Allow Motorcross bikes to ride in public parks or fields
attributes.background: Allow Motorcross bikes to be ridden in fields or parks instead of being chased by police

attributes.action: Canadian citizens should be allowed to live in the UK without a residence visa.
attributes.background: Canadians have the oath to The Queen. The UK government should consider Canadians as their fellow home citizens. Canadians should not be treated as foreigners and I believe they should not be restricted to live in their second home by holding a residence visa!
attributes.additional_details: Canadian banknotes, coins, visas and many of the other legal identities have a picture of The Queen.

attributes.action: Take the National Lottery license away from Camelot.
attributes.background: Camelot is not a British company. The profits go to its owners in Canada. Since taking possession of Camelot they have changed the odds and made it harder to win and invented the useless 'FREE LUCKY DIP' Prize. The whole game needs an overhall with more smaller prizes to keep in interesting.
attributes.additional_details: When the National lottery first started it had a jackpot of £8million every Saturday and even the Wednesday draw generated a £6million prize. Now it is less than 1/2 of this because people have lost interest/faith in the current set up. They doubled the ticket cost and that put even more people off, then reduced the chance of winning even a small prize. Now the only way it generate interest is with roll-overs created because not enough people play to win the prize

attributes.action: Chain restaurants and cafes have to offer blue badge tables for wheelchair users
attributes.background: It should be a legal requirement for large chain restaurants and cafes to have a blue badge table, where wheelchair bound citizens feel as though they can be comfortable and not in the way.
attributes.additional_details:
My mother recently suffered a stroke and is now wheelchair bound. As a strong independent woman, she has lost alot yet loves to enjoy a nice meal or coffee on a day out. However many times we will enter a restaurant or cafe to find that their isn't a spot or enough space. This means a simple journey to a cafe can lead to looking through 3 or 4 different ones. 

In 2017, this should not be an issue, parking is supplied for the less abled, this should be a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Random and unannounced illegal drug testing for all members of parliament.
attributes.background: Random drug testing has become common place within the UK workplace. From the Police to factory workers to warehouse operatives to administration clerks. This same deterrent must be actioned to test the people who hold one of the most important roles in the country whose decisions affect society.

attributes.action: Make Kirkby part of Lancashire again.
attributes.background: Historically Kirkby, a town mentioned as far back as the Domesday Book was part of Lancashire, until being acquired by the Liverpool corporation in 1947. I believe, Kirkby would truly be a prosperous place if it was taken away from Merseyside and returned to its rightful place as part of Lancashire.

attributes.action: Public sector Pension to transfer to partner without the need to be married.
attributes.background: More and more people choose to live together without feeling the need to marry. However we still have certain pension company's that still refuse to recognise that you exist as a loving and committed couple if you don't marry. This needs to change. Please sign and show your support.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently a high court ruling of a case in Ireland was won by a widower. They had been a couple for 10 years and had recently become engaged. Tragically her fiancé died at 43 years old. She was then told by the pension company that she wouldn't be eligible to claim his pension due to not being married. She then had to fight and with the support of a crowd funding page
successfully won her case.

attributes.action: Designate certain careers as a 'Public Service Vocation' with specific benefits.
attributes.background: Doctors, nurses, teachers, the military, social workers and prison officers work, primarily, to provide and care for others and are not driven by financial rewards. This should be recognized by designating certain jobs as a 'Public Service Vocation' with enhanced benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Those who in the caring professions work selflessly in the community in schools, hospitals, prisons and in the armed forces. As they are not working for their own benefit and cannot, in the majority of cases, enhance their own pay packet by working any harder, they deserve special status in the tax system. They also deserve an entitlement to extended breaks in their working lives for rest and professional development so that they do not get 'burnt out' but enjoy long and fruitful careers.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS.
attributes.background:
The NHS is costing too much money.
People don't need other people's money to pay for their healthcare.
People should have to get private health insurance so they're always covered.
The government should only provide it for those who can't afford insurance or can't get it for any other reason.
attributes.additional_details:
The following is statistical and anecdotal evidence that private healthcare works better than that which is provided by the government.
In the United States (which has private healthcare system), they have three times as many mammograms per person than in Europe.
3.7 million people are currently waiting for healthcare.
In Essex, doctors twice cancelled potentially life-saving surgery for a patient with oesophageal cancer because there were no free beds in the intensive care unit.

attributes.action: Offer a National Savings & Investments Product that pays a 6% interest rate.
attributes.background: 21 Million Savers have again sustained a new blow, following National Savings interest rates recently being cut by up to 0.25 per cent.The Prime Minister, The Rt. Hon. Theresa May, had "pledged" to help those battered by record low interest rates, which have remained at a record low since 2008.
attributes.additional_details: On the one hand the Government maintains that it wants to champion Savers, yet on the other, it continues to cut rates.Savers have been punished time and time again.The Prime Minister has warned that rock bottom rates and quantitative easing had "bad side effects", including "making Savers poorer". She also stated " A change has got to come and we are going to deliver it". So please deliver it.The Government should offer through NS&I, a Savings Product which pays an interest rate of at least 6%.

attributes.action: Provide student loans for British students having to study abroad
attributes.background: Studying abroad is financially challenging, especially with the lack of support from your own country. Foreign students studying in England benefit from a student loan system, but British students studying abroad do not. The government should provide a student loans system for all British students.

attributes.action: Prevent owners taking their horses on main roads especially during peak hours.
attributes.background: Stop allowing horses to be ridden or pull a cart on main roads. Horses on main roads can cause serious danger and distress to the horse due to fast moving, loud vehicles. It can also cause major distruption for motorists who are often unable to over-take which can lead to queue build up.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 incidents involving horses ends in a fatality for individuals and almost always for the horse. Although accidents involving horses are not required to be recorded as an official incident, unless a person is injured, it happens quite frequently and can be traumatising for both horse owners and motorists. 
In the past, I have witnessed a horse being hit on a busy main road. The horse was badly injured and died at the scene. The owner of the horse was also injured and extremely traumatised.

attributes.action: Put legalizing medical cannabis to a referendum/ballot
attributes.background: If the prime minister is willing to quit the common market because of the will of the people then should medical cannabis for the sick be put to a Referendum/ballot to determine the will of the people? And act on it now!

attributes.action: Benefits for people who are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.background: People who are diagnosed with life long mental health issues, that affect there quality of life, should not be discriminated, it is hard as it is to find and get support when you are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.additional_details: People with mental health issues should be supported by the goverment, and evaluated to see if they are fit to work. There quality of life is much different, and  the goverment lacks the understanding of mental health conditions. It's is near impossible for somone with Bi-polar, ADHD or autisim to find work and should not be left abandoned by the goverment.

attributes.action: Make the Help to Buy 40% allowance available outside London in expensive areas
attributes.background: An interest free loan is available from the government for 5 years on a new build home. This is 40% in London and 20% outside London. Some areas of the UK, for example the South East, have house prices similar to London. In these areas the help should be proportionate.

attributes.action: Re-designate London and the South East's Green Belt as a 'National Park'.
attributes.background: London and the south easts green belt was introduced as a breathing space for Londoners to visit and totals about 580,000 hectares.  Overall the green belt is poorly visited, poorly signposted and visitor provisions, such as disabled access and toilet facilities are  generally non existent.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Parks were introduced to enhance and conserve the natural and cultural heritage of an area and to promote understanding and enjoyment of the special requirements of the park.  There are 10 National Parks in England, which come under the National Parks Authority. These parks are well managed. The parks encourage visitation, improve facilities and work with landowners.

The Green Belt has no such provision, and as such is in reality merely a green blob on the map, which people are aware of, but rarely visit. Access for much of it is limited and not advertised. This is not good enough.  The public should have better access to this countryside and be better encouraged 
to use it. Retitling the green belt would also afford it better protection from developers.
